frame.name: Forging
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> produces a <fen>Forgery</fen>, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of) a <fen>Standard</fen>. An instance of the <fen>Standard</fen> may actually exist that served as an original that is copied by the Agent, or the <fen>Standard</fen> exists only as an idea.
<ex>So who was it that <t>faked</t> the photo "showing" Jane Fonda and John Kerry with the Vietcong?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.
<ex><fex name="agt">He</fex> even <t>faked</t> her signature. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Forgery
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Forgery</fen> is the product that the <fen>Agent</fen> creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the <fen>Standard</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the imitation. </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the forging event logically follows. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>An action or state that the <fen>Agent</fen> intends to accomplish by producing the <fen>Forgery</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Standard
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Standard</fen> is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the <fen>Agent</fen> wants to pass the <fen>Forgery</fen> off as.</def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> in order to produce the <fen>Forgery</fen>.
<ex>Fortunately, he <t>forged</t> it <fex name="ins">with a black pen</fex>, which couriers never use.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The location in which the <fen>Agent</fen> makes a <fen>Forgery</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which the forgery takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Fidelity
FE.definition:
<def-root>The way in which the <fen>Forgery</fen> does or does not match the <fen>Standard</fen>.
<ex>What I don't know is why she tried to <t>forge</t> it <fex name="fid">half-size</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity corresponding to the <fen>Standard</fen> which the <fen>Agent</fen> scrutinizes in order to copy.
<ex>He <t>faked</t> his travel documents <fex name="sou">from the ones his sister used last year</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: counterfeit.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to create a forgery of an object, usually art or money, intending to pass it off as original

lexUnit.name: forge.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: produce a fraudulent copy or imitation of.

lexUnit.name: fake.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to produce a forgery intending to pass it off as the original

lexUnit.name: forgery [act].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of producing a fraudulent copy or imitation of (a banknote, work of art, etc.).

lexUnit.name: forgery [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a fraudulent copy or imitation of (a banknote, work of art, etc.).

lexUnit.name: fake.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person or thing that is not genuine.
